channel.title: BBC News - Wales
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Covid: Wales' red list students could face £1,750 quarantine fee
item.description: The National Union of Students says it is wrong that some universities will not cover the cost.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Geraint Thomas' hopes dashed in crash as Ecuador's Richard Carapaz wins road race gold
item.description: Geraint Thomas' medal hopes are dashed during fall in the men's road race as Ecuador's Richard Carapaz wins gold.

item.title: Holidays in Wales: How your staycation looked in 1971
item.description: The holiday camps are packed, the sun is shining and the phrase "staycation" is yet to be invented.

item.title: Girl's tragic balloon accident death marked 125 years on
item.description: Louisa Maud Evans, 14, fell to her death in an aeronautic display, triggering a change in the law.

item.title: Cardigan murder accused Ashley Keegan appears in court
item.description: Ashley Keegan, 22, is remanded in custody to appear before Swansea Crown Court on Tuesday.

item.title: Wales boss Ryan Giggs denies assaulting ex-girlfriend
item.description: He allegedly used controlling behaviour, including kicking his ex-girlfriend out of his hotel room naked.

item.title: Pontyclun crash: Three in hospital after car hits people outside pub
item.description: Police believe the driver of the car suffered a "medical episode" just before the crash.

item.title: Gwynedd man killed himself after paying romance scammers
item.description: "Gentle soul" Chris Leeds was found dead after parting with thousands of pounds, an inquest hears.

item.title: Racism probe as 'bananas thrown at Cardiff City academy players'
item.description: Probe as former Cardiff City youth team footballer says he and a team-mate were racially abused.

item.title: Briton Ferry bin lorry 'taken and crashed' as crew took break
item.description: Police are investigating reports three people took the lorry before it crashed into a wall.

item.title: Pollution: 'Bring houses down' plea for most polluted street
item.description: Homes on Hafodyrynys were supposed to be demolished - but are still standing and being ransacked.

item.title: Tusker Rock's shipwrecks graveyard captured in art project
item.description: Photographer Peter Britton wants his project to stand as a legacy to those lost to Tusker Rock.

item.title: Pontyclun crash: Aftermath after car hits pub, injuring six
item.description: The driver is believed to have had a "medical episode" before his car hit the pub.

item.title: Pollution: Former resident calls for demolition of homes
item.description: Martin Brown's house was due to be demolished because of air pollution.

item.title: NHS Wales pay rise offer: 'Claps don't pay the bills'
item.description: Nurses react to an offer of a 3% pay rise from Welsh government.

item.title: Covid: Young farmers' clubs lose half their flock in pandemic
item.description: Membership fell from around 4,000 to 2,000 during the pandemic, but is starting to improve.

item.title: Dinosaur footprint found by girl, 4, to go on display
item.description: The discovery by Lily may show how the extinct reptiles kept their feet on the ground.

item.title: British and Irish Lions 2021: Injured prop Wyn Jones replaced by Rory Sutherland against South Africa
item.description: Injured British and Irish Lions prop Wyn Jones is ruled out of Saturday's first Test against South Africa, with Scotland's Rory Sutherland starting and Mako Vunipola of England added to the bench.

item.title: Olympic women's football: Team GB beat Japan to qualify for knockout stages
item.description: Great Britain guarantee their progress to the knockout stages of the Olympic women's football competition with victory over hosts Japan in Sapporo.

item.title: Liverpool's Harry Wilson close to £12m Fulham move after leaving Reds training camp
item.description: Liverpool's attacking midfielder Harry Wilson is close to joining Championship side Fulham in a move understood to be worth about £12m.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Adam Peaty eases into semi-finals as Team GB's footballers secure place in knockouts
item.description: On day one of the Tokyo Olympics, Adam Peaty progresses while GB's women's footballers continue their winning ways.

item.title: British and Irish Lions 2021: Emotionally-charged South Africa pose huge challenge
item.description: The British and Irish Lions prepare to face a South Africa side driven to provide hope for their country.

item.title: Rhai myfyrwyr rhyngwladol yn wynebu ffi cwarantîn o £1,750
item.description: "Annerbyniol" medd undeb myfyrwyr fod rhai yn gorfod astudio o bell tan eu bod yn gallu fforddio talu'r gost.

item.title: Dyn o Aberteifi yn y llys ar gyhuddiad o lofruddio
item.description: Mae Ashley Keegan, 22, wedi ei gyhuddo o lofruddio John Bell mewn digwyddiad yn Aberteifi.

item.title: Ystyried gwahardd cŵn o 18 o draethau yng Ngwynedd
item.description: Penodi dau swyddog gorfodaeth ymhlith mesurau newydd i daclo problemau baw ci mewn mannau cyhoeddus.

item.title: Wyn Jones allan o dîm y Llewod gydag anaf i'w ysgwydd
item.description: Prop Cymru wedi anafu ei ysgwydd ac felly'n methu'r cyfle i ennill ei gap cyntaf dros y Llewod.
